text: I’m hoping to get vaccinated in the next couple of months, but it would likely be AstraZeneca. I guess it’s better than no vaccine?

elements.text: I’m hoping to get vaccinated in the next couple of months, but it would likely be AstraZeneca. I guess it’s better than no vaccine?

text: Absolutely better. We need vaccines in as many arms as possible. The preliminary evidence suggests that some vaccines are slightly more effective than others, but all of them are more effective than no vaccine, and we don't have any information on long-term immunity for any of them.

elements.text: Absolutely better. We need vaccines in as many arms as possible. The preliminary evidence suggests that some vaccines are slightly more effective than others, but all of them are more effective than no vaccine, and we don't have any information on long-term immunity for any of them.

attachments.title: COVID-19 vaccines seem to dramatically lower hospitalization risk after just one dose, according to data from the UK
attachments.text: The study in Scotland found that one jab of AstraZeneca's vaccine was linked to a 94% drop in hospitalization risk four weeks after the first dose.
attachments.fallback: Business Insider: COVID-19 vaccines seem to dramatically lower hospitalization risk after just one dose, according to data from the UK

text: I also saw someone claiming that the vaccines help with the “long covid”, but it wasn’t a scientific study.

elements.text: I also saw someone claiming that the vaccines help with the “long covid”, but it wasn’t a scientific study.

text: I have the feeling there has been a lot of bad communication about the astrazeneca vaccine

elements.text: I have the feeling there has been a lot of bad communication about the astrazeneca vaccine

text: I’m sure this is not how it was presented, but I remember hearing on the news that it’s not effective against the South-African variant. There were some percentages of something mentioned, but I’ve ignored them like the others, I think.

elements.text: I’m sure this is not how it was presented, but I remember hearing on the news that it’s not effective against the South-African variant. There were some percentages of something mentioned, but I’ve ignored them like the others, I think.

text: What is the measure of effectiveness though? If it at least prevents hospitalization and death with the SA variant, I’d want it, even if I still might get pretty sick.

elements.text: What is the measure of effectiveness though? If it at least prevents hospitalization and death with the SA variant, I’d want it, even if I still might get pretty sick.
